name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Absolutely my favorite place to go for either a day trip to the beach, or camping at the park. Beach is all sand, and you can walk out forever with amazing natural sandbanks here and there. There's also a dog beach with tons of space for ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
Love camping here. Lots of activities for the kids and the playground is great too. Clean washrooms/showers.

My only complaint is the beach is a little hike from the parking lot and the boardwalk seems short. But I understand that they don't want to ruin the natural areas.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
Great park.
Spacious sites.
Lots of vegetation between sites for excellent privacy.
Large, well groomed beach.
Water is only a few feet deep for about a kilometer out from shore. 
Great for young kids.
Book early in season since sites go quickly.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
I love this park! The beach is great. We were there on a long weekend and still had lots of space for beach volleyball and kite flying. The campsites are big and private. The washrooms/showers are new and clean. 
The town is a sleepy ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: So beautiful here.  We stayed 1 week on a ravine site. One of the unreservable sites. We were lucky to get it on the last week before school. Truly the nicest sites there. Washrooms facilities were exceptionally clean and lots of showers ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
Good sandy beach. Waves in the water which makes it fun. Dog friendly with a dedicated dog off leash area. 
Less crowded than some of the other beaches I have been to.
One downside is that the walk from parking lot to beach is a little longer than some other places.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great spot for camping or a beach trip. Well maintained. Close enough to local amenities should you need something. Rates seem a bit high, but considering the maintenance and service provided the price is justified.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great sites. Nice walks. Good bathroom shower and laundry facilities. You need very long hydro cables to connect to power source. Beach awesome but either a long walk or a short car ride.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: I thought it was a great public  nude beach.   $15 for entry clothing was in use on beach markers 1-5 but park in lot 5 and walk apx 500 yards past lot 6 and there is the nude beach.   Every type no need to be embarrassed because nobody ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Sites are beautiful, though staff is very strict and mostly teenagers on power trips or have no authority at all.  Use the eastern public beach as it is groomed, free and there's a French fry shack.  Also bring cash as the ice cream shop at the top of the hill doesn't take credit card.  Otherwise great fun.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Large beach, rather clean, separate area for dogs, spacious parking. Washrooms leave to wish better.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
Great spot, our first time visiting.  Nice mix of site types, and lots of space to explore.  Plenty of bathrooms, a very nice park for the kids and a huge field with badminton (and volleyball?) nets as well.

You are immediately greeted ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We had a great time catching into the big wave. The beach is shadow and is for the kids.  The only disappointment was the colour of the sand beneath the water.  It is black and brown and stained our swimming wear.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Awesome place to relax in a small town. Been here a few times and its surprisingly a pleasant enviroment to be in.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We came to stay for 1 night and ended up spending a whole week. A beautiful campground the sites have plenty of shade and are big. They have enough trees that you are fairly secluded from your neighbour which gives plenty of privacy. We ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great dog beach. Sandy and shallow. Warm water, I highly recommend going. First time there, but will definitely be back

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: This is a great place with very good public and provincial park beaches.  There are short but nice hiking trails, a good playground for kids and good facilities.  The nearby town of Port Burwell is small but very nice too and boasts a retired military submarine on display and open for tours.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Usually love this beach! Been here countless Times! Went today and had to pay by putting $ in a dropbox as it is late in the season. After depositing our $14.50 we found as we entered the beach area it was unbearable! We were swarmed by ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Well maintained & clean.generous sites in iroquois campground. Lovely walking trail. Spectacular beach. Sadly, swimming was not recommended when we were here. Helpful staff.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: As a first time camper I must say this park is very clean, we'll laid out with sites that include electrical hook ups, and privacy.  My family really enjoyed our stay and recommend it.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Well maintained, in a lovely small-town area on Lake Erie, large dog beach. Not over crowded even on busy weekends

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Lovely colours in the fall. Walk at own risk but lovely to have the park to yourself

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great beach area with nice sand and plenty of parking.  Much less busy than the free beach just next door in town. Trails to the beach from the camping areas exist, but you have to look carefully to see the signs for them.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We weren't exactly at the park but we did enjoy the beach just a few minutes down the road. P1 is the dog beach and I believe 2-5 is the other areas you may enjoy (just not with dogs). Very clean and lots of sticks to throw if you decide ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Large sites,   sandy beach, clean washrooms and great cycling through some of the best farm land in Ontario. This park has lots to offer

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
The provincial park beach is amazing.
If you go to the last parking lot it is less busy and is away from the dog beach.
The beach is monitored by park rangers so it is a family friendly safe environment

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great place for us big women ...u can feel good in your skin....no fee parking ..family oriented.  2volley ball courts..  Chip stand ...washroom outside ...inside @ outside shower.    ..no life guards..u r the life guards...watch for undercurrents..if wave r choppy

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Not much of a camper, but I know enough to recommend this park. Very pretty, good proximity to the pier, and nice showers!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Very well maintained campsites and facilities.  Friendly staff. Great kids playground and field.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Beautiful park but somewhat long walk to the beach. Go early or late as the midday sun is too hot for dogs paws to access the beach. Ice cream shop at dog beach

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great provincial park.  Each site seemed to be secluded and easy to make private.   Beech was awesome and good sand bars for my young kids.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: When you charge 14.50 for a one day pass. I can see why everyone wants to go to the free beach. This place has no picnic tables on the beach.the main public beach has lots. Bathrooms are limited and a long walk from the beach. No i would not return.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: strongly recommend large buffer zones between most sites for more private experience. bathrooms are newer and adequately attentend to

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Stayed in Leander section on the Civic holiday long weekend. Most sites were occupied by families with many children running around. But they were all well-behaved and there was no public drunkenness on the part of the adults. All this ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Extremely disappointing.  In a sentence, if you are looking for an outdoor actual camping experience, don't stay here.  Its right beside the town and you can see houses/cottages from the sites, we heard sirens and fire trucks several ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: It‚Äôs great if you‚Äôre looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of bigger beaches in the area like Grand Bend, but it comes at a cost. It‚Äôs isolated so good options are limited. There are no food choices in the immediate area other ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Campsites are always spacious, nice and well groomed. Bathrooms are kept spotless, and the staff is always helpful. Beach is great, even though the walk is long.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: The beach used to be a lot better when it was maintained.  It has now become overgrown in many areas in what is called "returning to a natural state."

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
This park is crazy. I've never seen more private sites in a Provincial Park.  There's a mix of relatively open sites, but there are just so, so many absolutely private spots.  The foliage is so dense!

The beach is perfectly maintained ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Amazing spot with fantastic dog beach.  Can be busy in high season but worth exploring.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
The site was lovely except for the picnic table which was long past its due date...I know it's not full season yet....but the spped limit around the park is not enforced enough..
We've stayed there for a few years now and can highly recommend it....

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Quiet beach, amazing water .... I like the fact it gets deep so you can actually swim.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Nice, quite, isolated place. Good for family RV trips

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Loved it there very clean ad u can bring your dog you can have them leash or Unleashed it's up to you perfect place to bring your dog

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
Large campsites but be prepared if your site is shadey. For any folks afraid if spiders there is an excessive amount of daddy long legs.  I would have preferred mosquitos since you just need off for them.   

Washrooms are maintained ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Other then the long walk from parking to the Optional Beach..Its Awesome !!  Clean beach & a good time üòé

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Provincial Park beach is a beautiful long sandy beach with long shallow section before water gets deep.   Water was beautiful temperature.  Like being in the Caribbean.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: A nice white sandy beach and blue water..reminds us of a few vacation spots overseas ,when you see this from the long boardwalk at the lighthouse you stand to wonder of all the nice areas in our own backyard.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Had a great time. Planning my trip back. Need to stay longer to make the most of it .

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great sites, amazing beach. One of the best provincial parks in SW Ontario.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review:
Wonderful park
Keep it clean please.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Awful service and pricing. Another case of Ontario gouging the public. Their website is always wrong and very misleading. Will think twice about going to any Ontario provincial park again. Brutal!!!! The only positive for this park is the off leash area of the beach

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Only one car per campsite. This sucks especially if you have a large family or are a part of bigger groups.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Beautiful place to go for weekend camping or day visit

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Very small campground su it  is quite. Only issue is that the beach is in a different area. You have to drive out of the campground and down the road to get to the beach.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Good camping area with decent shaded camp sites.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: It is very nice place to be.  The beaches very nice and clean and even the water was very clear.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Been going down for 28 years best memories as a kid. Miss the old sandy beach what it use to be.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Such a great campground. Has great playground area with lots of greenspace

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great park, private sites, great dog beach there every day just be forewarned there's always one bad dog owner in every crowd. Two boxers this past weekend one who was attacking biting others dogs at least six that I saw, owner would call dog back and give it a treat.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Has a great dog beach with an off leash area. Definitely coming back.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We went with our children and had an extraordinary experience in this park. I totally recommend Port Burwell Park for camping!!!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: I would like to see the wood path go all the way to the beach.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Absolutely one of the best world class beaches, and it has a dog friendly section that today was full of friendly playful dogs

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Nice park great staff. Park needs to be updated.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: The manager there is is horrible not customer friendly there was no one at the gate to take money . I was  .25 cents short of the $ 14.50 and she wanted me to drive into town to pay  the quarter  I mean really.  I paid$15.00 I  hop she saves it and uses it for the next person short

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great beach but the washrooms needs .ore maintenance.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great beach the waves were amazing today! Always a good visit to he park.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Loved it as a child and love it still. Beautiful park.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great beach! Shallow water and clean.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We had a great experience..love the Beach

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Not much to see.... Pt Burwell seems to be a town without much going for it. Lots of closed shops in the downtown. The beach is a 'Blue Flag' beach, so at least they take their beach appearance seriously.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: It's a great place to go there's a lot of fun stuff to see and do.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: The sites seemed to have good privacy and were a good size, and the washroom facilities seemed taken care of and clean. Would book here again :)

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: If you‚Äôre going, don‚Äôt miss the west beach (west of the Big Otter River). Simply exotic! Watch out for Poison Ivy (Toxicodendron radicans) and biting insects!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great camping big site's

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Good place for kids to have fun and enjoy the beach.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great park and the leash free dog beach  make it the best

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Nice provincial park. Not much for privacy between sites near the front, probly due to ash tree die off. Good trails beachs and facilities.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Becuase it says "dog beach" you basicly have the beach to your self

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: What a great place to visit. The beach area is wonderful...water is clean

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great beach, and very clean. Friendly people and dogs.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Pretty place. Liked the drive there

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Best dog breach, off leash too

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Visited the nude beach, nice place

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: I liked my first visit to the nudist beach but the mosquitoes were terrible. The beach needs a good clean-up. Way too many much branches and old driftwood could cut your feet. People were friendly the staff was too!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Best park that I have been. Very big sites. Awesome staff! Bathroom is clean all the time. Beach is great but windy. It would be great to have direct access to the  beach from the camping.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Quiet peaceful large Beach that one could get lost on if they wished beautiful sunsets clean water

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We've been to this park a number of times on a day pass. We absolutely love the area at the end of the park for its clothing optional ambience.  Spend an hour or two and enjoy the free feeling of letting it all hang out. The beach here ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Love camping here. Wish the visitor pass wasn't so expensive and there were more parking lots. Really enjoy the size of the lots and the privacy that each lot has

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great park that was not too busy and where you can enjoy a swim.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Very quiet, helpful pleasant staff, bathroom facilities are clean.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Incredibly beautiful campground and beach!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: We are not avid campers, but tend to visit one new park per year to spend time with our friends. Port Burwell is a little on the small side, in terms of parks, which is nice because it doesn't seem to attract a lot of the loud, rowdy ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Been camping here most of my life and now bring my kids too.  The new comfort stations are a huge improvement over the course of my life and the small town of Port Burwell has lots of things to see and do with kids.  Fishing is decent ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: nice park - nothing else in the area

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Beautiful amazing place to relax

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Love the beach at this provincial park.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great lake nice park.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: One of my favourite beaches. Very sandy, although pockets of crushed shells can get tough on the feet in places. Very long and easy to find a nice quiet spot to spend the day. Only down side is paying for a day pass

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Fun for the whole family or just friends

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Some electrical posts are on the wrong side for trailers, but otherwise a very nice place and would come again üôÇ

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: The provincial park is one of the best kept parks I have been to. The dog beach is a big draw as it is the only one in Port Burwell. the facilities are well kept and the trails are excellent for walking, jogging, or bike rides.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: The sites varied regarding privacy, shade, and size but overall were fine. The beach for the park is so overgrown with tons of branches in the sand. I believe this is due to a new motion to let the beaches go naturally. As an alternative, there is a city beach not far from the park which is clean/cleared.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Very well run campsite. Modern amenities such as shower and bathroom were much more than adequate and within walking distance of our campsite. The site itself was a good size. Not a lot of forest though.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Big private sites üòÜ

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Nice park. Large sites. Clean bathrooms & showers. Good hiking. Good playground. Beach was a bit of a walk but clean & not overly busy.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Very treed and quiet private sites.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great place to camp! Super private sites available. The off leash dog beach was a hit with the pooch and our friends! Plus the trail in the park was gorgeous and we'll maintained.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: A nice beach and the dog beach is probably one of the best in the area.  The water is fairy gradual entry so it is good for kids.  Some areas near the dog beach end have lots of water plants and mussels but near the main day use areas it ...

review: Good camping spot and beach!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Really nice park, small and quiet. Campsites are big and clean. Bathrooms were spotless all 3 days we were there. Highly recommended.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: This is our 4th stay here and we love it. Campsites are very decent size and most have some privacy. The dogs love the dog beach and the walks to it

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Just loved the beach.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Great experience at the park. It is a great spot for families, as they have nature programming for kids, large sports fields and playground. The sites range a lot in terms of privacy. Many are quite open in the area we were in (Alzores), ...

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: A huge park with many sites. We stayed on 96. Pretty good privacy between sites. A nice trail to beach but really far! The beach is one of the better sand beaches but is about a half hour walk from the campground. Bring bikes!

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: The Best Dog Beach in Canada.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park

review: Have been camping here for years. The park is beautiful and quiet. But still close enough to a town in case you need to get something

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Nice park, with a decent amount of privacy between camping spots. As a bonus, you have a clothing optional side in the west end of the beach.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: Nice large camp sites and a huge beautiful beaches. Soft sand with a dog section so everyone can play.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
review: This Provincial Park has a very lovely beach. Even has a dog beach at Beach #1. Great camping area.

name: Port Burwell Provincial Park
